thread.title: Hotshots dump Batang Pier for a 2-0 start
thread.title_full: Hotshots dump Batang Pier for a 2-0 start

author: ccolina
title: Hotshots dump Batang Pier for a 2-0 start
text:
By: Celest Flores-Colina - Online Sports Editor / @CFColinaINQ INQUIRER.net / 07:36 PM March 25, 2017 
Star dominated GlobalPort, 103-77, Saturday in a road game at Tubod, Lanao del Norte to stay unscathed in the 2017 PBA Commissioner’s Cup. 
Despite the return of the Batang Pier’s top star Terrence Romeo, the Hotshots still found a way to take over in the second half to win their second assignment so far. 
Star recovered from a 15-point opening quarter by going on a 63-point rampage led by import Tony Mitchell in the next two periods to build a comfortable lead heading into the last 12 minutes. ADVERTISEMENT 
Mitchell had 22 points and 17 boards to pace the Hotshots but also got ample help with rookie Jio Jalalon chipping in 15 points and six rebounds. 
Romeo, who is coming off an illness, registered 13 points, seven rebounds and eight assists for the Batang Pier but was negated by seven turnovers. 
Sean Williams carried GlobalPort, which absorbed yet another blowout, in a losing effort with 20 points and 14 rebounds.
